member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.DownloadNotifier
M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.DownloadNotifier.#ctor(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.param: Chunk size. Notifications will not exceed the chunk size.
Starting positon. Notifications will begin at the starting position in the document.
Ending position. Notifications will end at the ending position in the document. An ending position of -1 indicates that notifications are requested up to the end of the document.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.DownloadNotifier.OnChunkAvailableEventHandler
member.summary: OnChunkAvailableEventHandler is the delegate type of the event that that is fired when new data is available.
member.param: Chunk. Array of bytes from the document.
Chunk position. The position in the document where the chunk starts.
Whether this notification is for the last chunk in the notification stream.

member.name: E:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.DownloadNotifier.OnChunkAvailable
member.summary: OnChunkAvailable is the event that is fired for each new chunk in a document transfer.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimActiveDates

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimActiveDates.DateActiveFrom
member.summary: Gets the TrimDateTime property corresponding to when this object first became active. If the returned value is blank, it indicates that the item has always been active (until the DateActiveTo value).

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimActiveDates.DateActiveTo
member.summary: Gets the TrimDateTime property corresponding to when this object first became active. If the returned value is blank, it indicates that the item has always been active (until the DateActiveTo value).

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimActiveDates.ActiveDateRangeDescription
member.summary: Gets a string describing the period during which this object was active.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimActiveDates.IsActive
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this object is currently active.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimActiveDates.SetActiveDateRange(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimDateTime,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimDateTime)
member.summary: Sets the date range for which this object is active. Note that only the date component of the date and time is relevant for active date ranges.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn
member.summary: The TrimAddIn interface is defined so that SDK developers can develop a class that implements this interface. The class can then be registered with TRIM to support customising a number of elements of TRIM behavior. Note that your class must not require any constructor parameters.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.ErrorMessage
member.summary: The error message is used to report any details of errors that occur in certain functions that return false. The error message property should be initialised to blank on every function call

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.Initialise(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database)
member.summary: The Initialise function is called immediately after the class is constructed. It is provided so that developers can execute any data initialisation steps that may be considered necessary.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.GetMenuLinks
member.summary: This function returns an array of TrimMenuLink items that are used by TRIM to provide a customised Context menu for TRIM objects.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.IsMenuItemEnabled(System.Int32,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject)
member.summary: This function provides a menu enabler for an addIn menu link. It passes in the id of the menu item previously returned by the GetMenuLinks call. If you return false, it is useful to also set the ErrorMessage property, as TRIM will inspect this if a user prompt is required.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.ExecuteLink(System.Int32,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: This function will be called when the user has chosen to execute one on the links provided by GetMenuLinks. The user has chosen to execute the link with the specified trim object being selected. You should set the itemWasChanged property to true if you make any modifications to the provided TRIM object.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.ExecuteLink(System.Int32,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch)
member.summary: This function will be called when the user has chosen to execute one on the links provided by GetMenuLinks. The user has chosen to execute the link with the specified list of tagged trim objects. You should work through the provided list, as is appropriate to your link.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.Setup(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject)
member.summary: This function is called when a new object is about to be created. It is called after the new object has been constructed, but before any properties have been set by users or developers. Currently, it is only called for record objects, after the record type defaults bave been set.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.PreSave(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject)
member.summary: This function is called immediately before changes to an object are committed to the TRIM database. Return false to prevent the update from continuing (and set the ErrorMessage property). Inspect the Uri property of the modifiedObject to determine if a new object is about to be created (Uri = 0) or an existing object is being modified.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.PostSave(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function is called immediately after changes to an object have been committed to the TRIM database. The boolean parameter indicates whether the save was done to create a new object or whether it was a modification to an existing object.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.PreDelete(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject)
member.summary: This function is called immediately before an object is deleted from the TRIM database. Return false to prevent the delete from continuing (and set the ErrorMessage property).

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.PostDelete(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject)
member.summary: This function is called immediately after an object has been deleted from the TRIM database.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.SupportsField(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.FieldDefinition)
member.summary: Return true if this add-in supports selecting and verifying values for the specified Field Definition

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.SelectFieldValue(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.FieldDefinition,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject,System.String)
member.summary: Provide a user interface to allow a user to select an appropriate value for the specified Field Definition and then set that value on the supplied Trim object. Return true if a value was selected (and set) otherwise false to indicated that the user cancelled.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ITrimAddIn.VerifyFieldValue(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.FieldDefinition,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject,System.String)
member.summary: Verify the new string value for a Field Definition to be set on the nominated object. If the method returns false, it should set the ErrorMessage property for TRIM to issue an appropriate error message.

With the first copy of %R_TRIMCONTEXT% 'A - B' ordering is used.
With the second copy of %R_TRIMCONTEXT% 'B - A' ordering is used.

Is this the 'first copy' of %R_TRIMCONTEXT%?

member.summary:
The email has successfully been registered into %R_TRIM%.
However the attempt to remove or update the subject of the email in Outlook failed. There are several possible causes:
1. It was not possible to find the email as the permanent email ID could not be discovered within the EML email file.
This is due to the System Option to save email in EML format.
Try using MSG format instead.
2. You do not have the permission to modify the email in Outlook.
3. The Internet Message ID of the dragged email does not match the Internet Message ID of the original email.

member.name: F:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.MessageIds.core_gisbadPolygonFmt

Where lng is the longitude expressed as a number (eg. 149.822727) and lat is the latitude.
A polygon can contain any number of points.
The starting point and the end point must match.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplicationBase.TrimBinariesLoadPath
member.summary: Set TrimBinariesLoadPath, to force the SDK to load native binaries from a particular path. This will override the searching logic that the SDK would otherwise apply.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplicationBase.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the SDK, by explicitly loading native binaries. Once Initialize() returns successfully, subsequent calls to Initialize() have no effect. If Initialize() is not called by the application, it will be called implicitly by the SDK, when the first native-backed SDK method is called.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplicationBase.EnableSdkLeakTracking(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Enables or disables SDK leak tracking. If leak tracking is enabled, stack traces are collected upon the creation of each Database. If the leak tracker subsequently detects that one of these objects is being disposed by the garbage collector, rather than through explicit disposal, an error will be logged to the Windows Application event log. Such an error will only be logged once.
If leak tracking is enabled, SDK applications can also manually check for leaks by calling GetSdkLeakCount() and GetSdkLeakStackTraces() at arbitrary points in the application.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplicationBase.GetSdkLeakCount
member.summary: Gets the current number of SDK leaks. Requires SDK leak tracking to be enabled.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplicationBase.GetSdkLeakStackTraces
member.summary: Gets the current list of SDK leaks. Requires SDK leak tracking to be enabled.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplicationBase.GetSdkObjectCount
member.summary: Gets the current number of SDK objects that have not yet been disposed.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplicationBase.ToErrorCode(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.MessageIds)
member.summary: Converts the error message enumeration value to an ErrorCode that is used by the TRIMSDK TrimException class.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplicationBase.GetMessage(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.MessageIds)
member.summary: Retrieves a message with the specified message id from the TRIM Messages database.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplicationBase.GetMessage(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.MessageIds,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a message with the specified message id from the TRIM Messages database. The substitution string provided will replace all occurrences of %1% that are found inside the TRIM Message.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplicationBase.GetMessage(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.MessageIds,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a message with the specified message id from the TRIM Messages database. The substitution string substPercent1 will replace all occurrences of %1% that are found inside the TRIM Message. The substitution string substPercent2 will replace all occurrences of %2% that are found inside the TRIM Message.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplicationBase.GetMessage(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.MessageIds,System.String[])
member.summary: Retrieves a message with the specified message id from the TRIM Messages database. The array of substitition strings will replace the values %1%, %2%, ... that are found inside the message. Note that although the array index is 0-based, the substitution strings are 1-based, so substPercentStrings[0] will be used to replace %1%. A maximum of 8 substitution strings are currently supported.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplicationBase.GetMessage(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.MessageIds)
member.summary: Retrieves a message with the specified message id from the TRIM Messages database. The supplied database (if not null) will be used to do any customer-specific captioning of certain TRIM strings, and will also return the message in the language designated for the currently logged-on user in that database.

member.summary: The ProcessEvent method will be called by the TRIM Event Processing service so that third-party apps can do something in response to TRIM events.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEventProcessorAddIn.Test
member.summary: The Test method is called by TRIM Enterprise Studio to see if the addIn can be loaded correctly. You can overload this method to do your own extra testing if you wish. Return an empty or null string to indicate the test succeeded, otherwise an error message.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity
member.summary: An activity is the fundamental element of a workflow, and represents a unit of work to be performed by an action officer, usually within a defined time period

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for the Activity object, based on a supplied unique row identifier.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.ActivityId
member.summary: Gets the integer value which uniquely identifies this activity within this workflow or template.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.ActivityPriority
member.summary: Gets or sets a piPriority enum value indicating the priority of this Activity.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.ActualCost
member.summary: Gets or sets a currency value indicating the actual cost of completing this activity.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.ActualDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer containing the actual duration of this activity. This indicates the amount of time that was actually taken to complete this activity. The Activity has been completed if the activity.IsComplete property has the value 'true'.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.AssignedBy
member.summary: Gets a location object representing the user responsible for allocating the current assignee for this activity.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.AssignedTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the location that is responsible for completing this activity.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.AutoComplete
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to automatically complete this activity once started

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.CompletedBy
member.summary: Gets or sets the location that actually completed this activity.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.CompletedOnTime
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this activity has been completed and was completed before the due date.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.DateAssigned
member.summary: Gets the date this activity was assigned to the current assignee.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.DateAuthorized
member.summary: Gets a datetime value indicating when this activity was fully authorized. If this activity has no authorization, this property and 'completed' will have the same value.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.DateCompleted
member.summary: Gets or sets the date this activity was completed, if it has been completed. Note that only a workflow administrator can change a completion date, and only if it is not blank.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.DateDue
member.summary: Gets the date this activity is due for completion.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.DateEarliestStart
member.summary: Gets the earliest date on which this activity may be started, based on the quickest available path for completion.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.DateLatestStart
member.summary: Gets the latest date by which this activity should be started. This date is calculated based on the workflow taking the longest path to completion.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.DateSkipped
member.summary: Gets a datetime value indicating when this activity was skipped.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.DateStarted
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time this activity was started.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.DateSuspended
member.summary: Gets a datetime value indicating that this activity is suspended.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Activity.DateSuspendedUntil
member.summary: Gets a datetime value indicating when this activity is due to resume.

member.summary: Gets or sets an adAprDateType enum value indicating the date type that should trigger the Automated Part Rule event. The values are 'adDateCreated', 'adDateFinalized', 'adDateInactive', 'adDateModified', 'adDatePublished', 'adDateRegistered', 'adFixedDate', 'adUserDefined' or 'adNone'.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.AutoPartRule.DelayInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer indicating the size of the time interval to be used between the date of type AutomatedPartRule.AprDateType and the part closure and creation of the Automated Part Rule event, unless the event is specified to occur on a fixed date. The type of each unit interval used by this property (i.e. days, weeks, months, years) is determined by the value of the AutoPartRule.AprDelay property.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.AutoPartRule.DelayType
member.summary: Gets or sets a diDateInterval enum value indicating the type of time interval to be used between the date of type AutomatedPartRule.AprDateType and the part closure and creation of the Automated Part Rule event, unless the event is specified to occur on a fixed date. The size of this time interval (i.e. number of intervals of this type) that should pass between the event and the new part creation is determined by the value of the AutoPartRule.AprDelay property.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.AutoPartRule.Description
member.summary: Gets a string containing a description of this Automated Part Rule, specifically the event type of this Automated Part Rule followed by a summary of when the Automated Part Rule event should occur.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.AutoPartRule.FixedDate
member.summary: Gets or sets a fixed date for the event involving closure and creation of parts to occur for records using this AutoPartRule.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.AutoPartRule.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the name identifying this Automated Part Rule.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.AutoPartRule.PartRuleType
member.summary: Gets or sets a arAprType enum value indicating the type of event that should occur with this Automated Part Rule. That is, whether records using this Automated Part Rule that are parts should simply be closed ('arClose') or closed with the creation of a new part record ('arCloseAndCreate') at a set time interval after the record's date of the date type for this Automated Part Rule.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.AutoPartRule.UserDefinedDateField
member.summary: Gets or sets a FieldDefinition object representing the user defined field of type 'udfDate' the value of which should start the time interval for records using this AutoPartRule, when the AutoPartRule is of date type 'adAprDateType.adUserDefined'.

member.name: F:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BarcodePrintOption.InternalClear
member.summary: Print Content Manager Barcode, Clear Any Foreign Barcode

member.name: F:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BarcodePrintOption.External
member.summary: Print Foreign Barcode, if it exists

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BlockedSearchMethodsUserOptions
member.summary: Blocked Search Methods|Search Methods that are hidden from normal user-interface (BlockedSearchMethodsUserOptions)

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BlockedSearchMethodsUserOptions.#ctor(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database)
member.summary: Constructor for the BlockedSearchMethodsUserOptions option set.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader
member.summary: The BulkDataLoader object is designed to provide a high-performance method of loading records (and a few other associated things) into a TRIM database. The intention is to run this component inside a WorkgroupServer to avoid network RCF calls, and also to allow us to run at the sort of privilege where we can use the inherent DBMS bulk loading tools, etc.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.#ctor(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Origin)
member.summary: Constructs a BulkDataLoader component based on the supplied Origin object.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.Initialise
member.summary: Initialise the environment prior to running any bulk loading operations. This method should be called directly after constructing a BulkDataLoader object. It will search for a database connection string as well as database utilities required for bulk inserting (for example Oracle SQLLDR.exe). Returns true for success. The ErrorMessage property should be checked when the return value is false.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.Initialise(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialise the environment prior to running any bulk loading operations. This method should be called directly after constructing a BulkDataLoader object. If you specify to use the fast "bulk loading" mode, it will search for a database connection string as well as database utilities required for bulk inserting (for example Oracle SQLLDR.exe). Returns true for success. The ErrorMessage property should be checked when the return value is false.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.Initialise(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialise the environment prior to running any bulk loading operations. This method should be called directly after constructing a BulkDataLoader object. If you specify to use the fast "bulk loading" mode, it will search for a database connection string as well as database utilities required for bulk inserting (for example Oracle SQLLDR.exe). You can also specify that you wish to turn off certain intrinsic HP RM behaviour to spped up performance (eg this will turn off some duplicate checking) or you can turn off other business rules that can be a problem when running imports as part of data conversion. Returns true for success. The ErrorMessage property should be checked when the return value is false.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.StartRun(System.String)
member.summary: Tells the bulk loader that a run is about to commence. Allows you to specify the actual source object being used, and creates a history row. Returns the Uri allocated to this history run.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.StartRun(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Tells the bulk loader that a run is about to commence. Allows you to specify the actual source object being used, as well as an alternate working directory into which the .DAT BULK INSERT files will be created and then subsequently read by the SQL server instance, so the path specified must be accessible to the SQL host machine. If this method is used, then the streaming of the bulkloader data files by the Workgroup Server is disabled. This will also create a history row. Returns the Uri allocated to this history run.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.NewRecord
member.summary: Creates a new record for submission to the bulk loader. You should then set its document and then its properties using the SetDocument and SetProperties functions and any other required setup code. Once the record has been prepared it is submitted to the loader process using the SubmitRecord method. If this method returns a null item, check the ErrorMessage property.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.NewRecord(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.RecordType)
member.summary: Creates a new record for submission to the bulk loader. You should then set its document and then its properties using the SetDocument and SetProperties functions and any other required setup code. Once the record has been prepared it is submitted to the loader process using the SubmitRecord method. If this method returns a null item, check the ErrorMessage property. This version allows you to specify the record type you wish to create.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.SetDocument(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Record,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.InputDocument,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkLoaderCopyMode)
member.summary: Sets the electronic document for the new TRIM record on the supplied TrimObject using input document provided. If the method returns false, you can check the ErrorMessage property for more details. See further comments for each of the BulkCopyStyle options.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.SetDocument(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Record,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.InputDocument)
member.summary: Calls SetDocument with a BulkCopyStyle of WindowsFileCopy

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.SetProperties(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyOrFieldValueList)
member.summary: Sets the properties on the supplied TrimObject using the array of property values supplied. If the method returns false, you can check the ErrorMessage property for more details.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.AllocateContainer(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Record)
member.summary: Sets the container for the new record based on the Origin container allocation algorithm. If the property ContainerCreation is set to true for the Origin object, then the container will automatically be allocated when you call SubmitRecord. If you need access to the record's allocated container prior to submitting the record, then you can do the container allocation explicitly by calling this method.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.SubmitRecord(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Record)
member.summary: Adds the new record to the data loader input files. At this stage, the record is not created in TRIM - the actual processing is performed in the ProcessAccumulatedData function. Returns the uri that will be allocated to the new record when it is finally created. If the function returns 0, look at the ErrorMessage property for further details of the error.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.UpdateDocument(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimURI,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.InputDocument,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkLoaderCopyMode)
member.summary: Adds a document update transaction into the set of data loader input files. At this stage, the record is updated in TRIM - the actual processing is performed in the ProcessAccumulatedData function. If the function returns false, look at the ErrorMessage property for further details of the error. See further comments for each of the BulkCopyStyle options.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.UpdateDocument(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimURI,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.InputDocument)
member.summary: Calls UpdateDocument with a BulkCopyStyle of WindowsFileCopy

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.FindRecord(System.String)
member.summary: Use mainly to check to see if a record with the specified record number exists. It is faster to use this method than the standard FindTrimObjectByName function, although still costs a server round trip. Returns the unique identifier of the matching record, or 0 if no match is found.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.FindLocation(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyValue)
member.summary: Find a location that has the matching property value. The property values supported are : LocationSortName, LocationIdNumber, LocationEAddressName The function returns the uri of the location that matches. If no location matches the supplied value, a value of zero is returned. In addition, if there is more than one matching location, a value of zero is returned.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.FindAllLocations(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyValue)
member.summary: Finds all locations that are not people and match the supplied LocationSortName property. The function returns an array of uris for all matching locations. If no matches are found, the function will return null.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.FindPerson(System.String,System.String,System.String,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimDateTime)
member.summary: Finds a person that matches the supplied parameters. Leave any of the parameters blank if you do not want to match on that property. The function returns the uri of the person that matches. If no person matches the supplied criteria, a value of zero is returned. In addition, if there is more than one matching person, a value of zero is returned.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.FindAllPeople(System.String,System.String,System.String,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimDateTime)
member.summary: Finds all people that match the supplied parameters. Leave any of the parameters blank if you do not want to match on that property.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.NewLocation
member.summary: We recommended you use the NewLocation(LocationType) form of this function.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.NewLocation(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.LocationType)
member.summary: Creates a new location of the specified type for submission to the bulk loader. You should then set its properties using the UpdateProperties function and any other required setup code. Once the location has been prepared it is submitted to the loader process using the SubmitLocation method. If this method returns a null item, check the ErrorMessage property.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.SubmitLocation(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Location)
member.summary: Adds the new location to the data loader input files. At this stage, the location is not created in TRIM - the actual processing is performed in the ProcessAccumulatedData function. Returns the uri that will be allocated to the new location when it is finally created. If the function returns 0, look at the ErrorMessage property for further details of the error.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.ProcessAccumulatedData
member.summary: This function processes all the data that has been supplied by calls to AddRecord, AddLocation, etc. The BulkDataLoader formats input files suitable for bulk loading into the various SQL engines - this is the function that passes these files off to the SQL engine for processing.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.EndRun
member.summary: This function indicates that this import run is complete, any outstanding batches will be processed, the run history row will be updated for a final time and events will be generated to schedule the text and content indexing of any records created.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.CreateContentIndexEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether the bulk loader should notify the event processor to index the content related to a batch of records. You can create this event notification later using the TRIM User interface if you wish to defer the indexing work.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.DoWordIndexing
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether the bulk loader should perform word indexing for imported records. If word indexing is suppressed, then the records will need to be indexed manually later. This can be done using the HPE CM User interface and selecting the appropriate option for the origin history.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.CreateWordIndexEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating how the bulk loader should do word indexing. The records can be indexed by generating an event for the event processor, or directly indexed as part of the bulk loader processAccumluatedData command. If the DoWordIndexing property is set to false, then this property will have no effect.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.RunHistoryUri
member.summary: Gets the run history object associated with this run. This object is created by the StartRun function.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.LogFileName
member.summary: Specify the name of a log file where the bulk loader will write diagnostic information in the event that the update to the database fails. If there are no errors during the update, then this file will not be written to and generally, it should not contain anything. The accepted method of error checking during the bulk loading process is to verify the return values of all methods and to check the ErrorMessage property if something unexpected occurs. Set this property before you call StartRun.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.UseOracleDirectPathLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to use the Oracle Direct Path Load feature when loading data using the Oracle SQLLDR utility. TYpically you would use this if the load is being run while TRIM users are not actively using the system and there is no other concurrent record update activity happening.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.SQLServerTableLock
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to use the TABLOCK command line parameter for the SQL server BULK INSERT command. TABLOCK can improve performance however may cause other user updates to slow down. Refer to the SQL Server documentation for BULK INSERT for further information.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.SQLCheckConstraints
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to enable the "CHECK CONSTRAINTS" directive during BULK INSERT operations. There is a performance hit when enabling this setting, but it does ensure that table constraints are honoured. The default setting of false can mean that certain unique indexes on tables are not enforced and therefore will need to be fixed manually. Refer to the SQL Server documentation for BULK INSERT for further information.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.UseBulkLoaderRecordNumbering
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether records should use the special BULK loader numbering system, or whether to use the numbering provided with the record type. It should be noted that the Record Type numbering options involves a round trip to the workgroup server and so will not result in the best performance. Default value is true.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.StreamDataToWorkgroup
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether the intermediate data files need to be streamed up to the workgroup server, or whether the database server is capable of processing them directly.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.AutoCommitLocations
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether Locations should be processed immediately. When using the bulkloader for creating locations, it is often difficult to use these locations because the bulkloader approach means the location details are not available for verification purposes until after the batch commit step, which is a call to the ProcessAccumulatedData() method. In particular, using imported locations as: Record Assignee, Record Home or Record Owner, require a location that exists in the database. For a value of true, Locations will be saved to the database as soon as they are encountered, i.e. during the SubmitLocation() method. Searching for the Location will return a result, thus avoiding a duplicate Location from being created. This turns bulkloading off for Locations and the Location is processed in the same way as it would be using the standard SDK methods to create a Location. If set to false (default), Locations will be saved to the database when the batch is processed, i.e. after a call to ProcessAccumulatedData(). Searching for the Location prior to this will not yield a successful result.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.ExtractMetadataFromContent
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether content should be examined for metadata when attaching a document to a new record. Basic metadata is obtained from the document title and creations date, however you can get further information such as document properties for openXML docs or EXIF data from JPG files if you enable this option.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.CreateContactsFromEmailRecipients
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether contacts should be created from email recipients.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BulkDataLoader.CreateContactsOnlyForExistingLocations
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating when creating contacts from email recipients, limit contacts to only locations that already exist in the dataset. This prevents creating new 'unknown' locations from email addresses that haven't already been registered for a location.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Census
member.summary: The census object keeps track of census activities performed for a certain location

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Census.CensusLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the Content Manager Location object this Census object applies to. The Census will base its recording on the assignment of records to this Location and any of its member Locations.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Census.EndDate
member.summary: Gets the end date of the Census. The value of this property is set when the Census is completed, which may be done by using the method Census.Complete.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Census.InProgress
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating whether the Census is currently in progress. If this property is true, the Census has started but has not yet been completed.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Census.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the name of this Census object.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Census.RecordsEnd
member.summary: Gets the number of records still confirmed to be assigned to the selected census location or its members (of the Census.CensusLoc property) at the end of the Census period.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Census.RecordsMissing
member.summary: Gets the number of records that were not marked by the census. During a census, all Content Manager records assigned to the selected census location are reassigned to a location that matches their physical location (which may be the original assignee location). The census process ensures that assignee locations in Content Manager are up to date with the physical locations of records within an organization. All records that were not reassigned in the Census cannot be confirmed to be physically at a location and are considered not marked by the census.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Census.RecordsStart
member.summary: Gets the number of records assigned to the selected census location or any of its members (of the Census.CensusLoc property) at the start of the Census period.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Census.StartDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the start date of the Census.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Census.Complete(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimDateTime)
member.summary: Sets the census to completed status. The completion date is set to the nominated date.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CheckinPlace
member.summary: A check in place defines a collection of documents held within an external system that is going to be checked in to Content Manager

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CheckinPlace.#ctor(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimURI)

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.ChildPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the numbering pattern by which the identification number of sub classifications will be set. The starting number (last number used) is held in the Classification.ChildPatternLastNbr property. No child classifications can be created unless this pattern is defined.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.ClassOfRecord
member.summary: Gets or sets a RecordClass enum value indicating the default record class to be applied to records of this classification. This record class will replace any default record class assigned to the record through record type.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.ContainerCreation
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether containers should be created when auto-classifying records into this classification.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.ContainerDateInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets an enumerated value indicating whether the date range for the container should be a day, a week, a month or a year when auto-classifying records into this classification

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.ContainerHasDateRange
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean parameter indicating whether containers should be allocated based on a date range for contained items when auto-classifying records into this classification.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.ContainerPerOwner
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether the classification should allocate a new container based on the Owner Location of the document being auto-classified into this classification

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.ContainerPerUserField
member.summary: Gets or sets a field Definition object indicating that the classification should allocate a new container based on the value of the specified user defined field when auto-classifying records into this classification

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.ContainerSizeThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets a number which determines the maximum number of contained items for containers created when auto-classifying records into this classification

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.ContainerType
member.summary: Gets or sets the record type to be used when creating containers to be used when auto-classifying records into this classification.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.DefaultJurisdiction
member.summary: Gets or sets the default jurisdiction of this classification. A classification can either have a default jurisdiction or a default jurisdiction group.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.HomeLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the default home location for records of this Classification. The home location is traditionally used to hold the storage location of a record. This Location will replace any default home location assigned to the record through record type.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.IdNumber
member.summary: Gets a string containing the unique identification number for this Classification. This number uniquely identifies the Classification amongst all other Classifications. It consists of the level number (Classification.LevelNumber) for this Classification preceded by the level numbers of all the parent classifications in this classification's hierarchy. The number will appear compressed (any leading zeros removed) if the numbering pattern for this classification involves upper case numeric characters. The numbering pattern for this Classification is held in the ChildPattern property of its parent classification.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.IdNumberUncompressed
member.summary: Gets a string containing the expanded form of the unique identification number for this Classification. This consists of the expanded level number (Classification.LevelNumberUncompressed) for this Classification preceded by the expanded level numbers of all the Classification terms in this Classification's hierarchy.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.IdolCategory
member.summary: Gets or sets the IDOL category ID associated with this classification - used for category training and automatic classification.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.IsApproved
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating that this classification has been approved for use in classifying records.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.LevelNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the level number for this Classification. This number uniquely identifies the Classification amongst the other Classification levels of the same parent Classification. The level number will appear compressed (any leading zeros removed) if the numbering pattern for this classification involves upper case numeric characters. The numbering pattern for this Classification is held in the ChildPattern property of its parent Classification.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.LevelNumberUncompressed
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the expanded form of the level number for this Classification. This number uniquely identifies the Classification amongst the other classification levels of the same parent classification.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.MinimumConfidenceLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a number value (1-100) indicating the minimum confidence level attained before this classification can be selected for Auto-Classification

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the name of this Classification object. This is the name of this Classification level alone, for example 'General' (sub classification in the 'Accommodation - Domestic - General' hierarchy).

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.NumberingIsManual
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating whether the numbering of records using this Classification requires manual input.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.OwnerLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the default owner location for records of this Record Type. The owner location traditionally has responsibility for a record. Only users that belong to the owner location of a record can initially set its access controls. This Location will replace any default owner location assigned to the record through record type.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.ParentClassification
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent classification for this classification. Top level classifications do not have a parent classification. When setting the ParentClassification, a number of default values will be inherited from the parent, so you should set this property first on any new classification.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.PendingAutoClassification
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean property indicating whether this classification is used as a holding bay for the auto classification processor

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.PolicyCentreGUID
member.summary: Gets or sets a GUID value indicating the unique identifier for this classification in the Policy Center integration

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.PreventAutoClassification
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean property indicating whether this classifiication is excluded from the set of classifications used by the Auto-Classification tool

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.RecordLastNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the starting number for any new records created with this Classification, if they are numbered by classification. This should be set to a value that matches the numbering pattern determined by the Classification.RecPattern property.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.RecordPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the numbering pattern by which the record number for records created with this Classification should be set, if the records are numbered by classification. The starting number (last number used) is held in the Classification.RecPatternLastNbr property. No records can be created from this level unless this pattern is defined.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.RetentionSchedule
member.summary: Gets or sets a Schedule object which is the Retention Schedule that should be applied to records of this Classification. This Retention Schedule will replace any default schedule assigned to the record through record type.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Classification.Title
member.summary: Gets a string containing the title of this Classification object, used as the generated part of the title when titling records by classification. It consists of the name of this Classification level (held in the Classification.Name property) preceded by the names of all the Classification terms in this Classification's hierarchy. For example, 'Accommodation - Domestic - General' is the title of the Classification with name 'General'.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ClassifiedSecurity
member.summary: The ClassifiedSecurity class is used when implementing the US DoD Classified Security standard. It is necessary to manage all updates to a Record's Security Classification using this class, rather than the TrimSecurityProfile class, to comply with the US DoD standard. Classified Security extends a normal security by classification by scheduling declassification and downgrading events

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ClassifiedSecurity.SetInitialData(System.String,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile,System.String,System.String,System.String,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimDateTime,System.String,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.SecurityGuideList)
member.summary: Set initial security classification of this record.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef
member.summary: CommandDef : This class encapsulates a command that can be executed against a TRIM base objects. It can be used to determine if a command is enabled for an object, and there are also some localised command string and icons that can be useful.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.#ctor(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandIds,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database)
member.summary: Construct a new CommandDef object based on the TRIM::taskIds enumeration, specifying a TRIM database that can be used for any custom captioning

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.CommandId
member.summary: Gets the commandId enum value for this CommandDef object

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.Icon
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the TRIM icon associated with this command.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.NeedsAnObject
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this command must have an object for it to be executed.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.IsNavigationCommand
member.summary: Indicates if this command is a navigation command, which basically means a new set of items will be generated as a result

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.IsListCommand
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this command that is executed by a list

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.RefreshStyle
member.summary: Gets a crtCommandRefreshTypes enum value indicating the type of UI refresh that may be required after the command has executed

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.IsAvailableTagged(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Indicates whether the currently logged in user has permission to execute this command against an object of the specified type. If the function returns false, the ErrorMessage property will contain an informational message indicating why the task is unavailable.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.IsAvailable(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Indicates whether the currently logged in user has permission to execute this command against an object of the specified type. If the function returns false, the ErrorMessage property will contain an informational message indicating why the task is unavailable.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.IsEnabled(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject)
member.summary: Indicates whether the command execution is enabled for the specified object. If the function returns false, the ErrorMessage property will contain an informational message indicating why the task is unavailable.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.IsEnabled(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Indicates whether the command execution is enabled when no specified object, but you are working with a list of the specified object types. Typically this will return false unless the NeedsAnObject property is false. If the function returns false, the ErrorMessage property will contain an informational message indicating why the task is unavailable.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.IsEnabled(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject)
member.summary: Indicates whether the command execution is enabled when processing a list with the specified objected selected. You can specify a null value for withObjectSelected if no item has been selected.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.IsEnabled(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimChildObject)
member.summary: Indicates whether the command execution is enabled for the specified child object. If the function returns false, the ErrorMessage property will contain an informational message indicating why the task is unavailable.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.IsEnabled(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimChildObjectList)
member.summary: Indicates whether the command execution is enabled for a child list, when no specified child object is selected. Typically this will return false unless the NeedsAnObject property is false. If the function returns false, the ErrorMessage property will contain an informational message indicating why the task is unavailable.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.IsEnabled(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimChildObjectList,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimChildObject)
member.summary: Indicates whether the command execution is enabled for a child list, with the specified child object selected (can be NULL) If the function returns false, the ErrorMessage property will contain an informational message indicating why the task is unavailable.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.GetMenuEntryString(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a menu string used when applying the command to the specified object type

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.GetTooltip(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a tooltip string when applying the command to the specified object type

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.GetStatusBarMessage(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Gets a status bar message string when applying the command to the specified object type

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.CommandDef.GetAllCommands(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database)
member.summary: Constructs an array of all command definitions for the nominated object type.

members.member: Note that the IEnumerator documentation requires an InvalidOperationException to be thrown whenever the collection is modified. This has been done for changes in the size of the collection but not when one of the elements of the collection is modified as it is a bit tricky to detect unmanaged code that modifies the collection under our feet.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment

member.summary: This form of the consignment constructor allows you to specify to use the special aggregated box selection style.

member.summary: Gets a flag to indicate whether the initial record selection will include record with a disposal schedule contradicting the cutoff date or method of this consignment

member.summary: Gets or sets the archivist responsiible for this consignment

member.summary: Gets the date from which this Consignment is cutoff.

member.summary: Gets the date that all records were automatically examined for issues.

member.summary: Gets a string containing a description of this Consignment

member.summary: Gets a consignmentDisposalType enumerated value indicating how the items within this consignment will be disposed.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.DoApprovals
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether the records within this consignment need to be approved for disposal.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.FilterString
member.summary: Gets a string value which defines filters for the search.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.IsComplete
member.summary: Gets a boolean flag to indicate whether this consignment is now complete.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.LogRecord
member.summary: Gets the record that has the logfile of the disposal processing

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.NbrApprovers

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.NbrApproversPending
member.summary: Gets the number of approvers that have not completed their approval process

member.summary: Gets the number of records that failed to be disposed do to errors in disposal processing

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.NbrDisposed
member.summary: Gets the number of records that were successfully disposed as part of the processing of this consignment

member.summary: Gets the number of records currently proposed for consignment that have an issue

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.NbrRecordsNow
member.summary: Gets the number of records currently proposed for consignment

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.NbrRecordsStart

member.summary: Gets the number of rejected records still requiring confirmation of removal from the consignment

member.summary: Gets a boolean flag to indicate whether the approval should be sought from the owners of the selected records before disposing.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.QueryString
member.summary: Gets a string value which defines the main criteria search.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.SelectingTopContainers
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether the initial record selection should use the top container aggregation search style.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.SignedApprovals
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether consignment approvers need to digitally sign an approval document.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.Status
member.summary: Gets a ConsignmentStates enumerated vale indicating the current state of the consignment.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Consignment.UseOwnerAdminForApproval
member.summary: Gets a boolean flag to indicate whether the approval should be sought from the administrator of the owner Locations (if the owner location has an administrator).

member.summary: Gets a boolean flag to indicate whether the consignment is currently waiting for acknowledgement of a successful transfer.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database
member.summary: The Database object is the first object that must be created when using the TRIM SDK. All other objects in the SDK are dependent upon this object -- they cannot be created independently. The Database object is responsible for making a connection to a TRIM database and for creating all SDK objects that are to be used by the client

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ActionReminder
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean parameter to indicate whether a reminder email message should be sent when an action is approaching its due date

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ActionReminderInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer containing the time (in seconds) before the due date when a reminder email should be sent for an action.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ActivityReminder
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean parameter to indicate whether a reminder email message should be sent when an activity is approaching its due date

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ActivityReminderInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer containing the time (in seconds) before the due date when a reminder email should be sent for an activity.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AddHoldToContainedRecord
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether records that are within a container may be added to Holds.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AddToContainerOnHold
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether records can be added to a container which is on hold. Note that holds that affect disposition only will always allow contents to be added.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AllowCatalogMessageBodyOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether TRIM should allow users the option of only cataloguing the body of an email message (without attachments)

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AllowLargeFolders
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether TRIM should implement business rules based on folders possibly containing large numbers of contained items (>500)

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AllowManualSentItemsCheckin
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean parameter indicating that, when using the Outlook Add-In, users can directly check in email from the Sent Items folder

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AllowUsersToSetDblClick
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean parameter indicating whether users are allowed to set the double click behavior for %bs_record%

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AlternatelyContainDuplicateMail
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether TRIM should create an alternate container for a duplicated email message, rather than creating a new record

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AlternateWorkgroupServerName
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the name of an alternative Workgroup Server to use to connect to this database. The alternate workgroup is used if the main workgroup server is unavailable.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AlternateWorkgroupServerPort
member.summary: Gets or sets a number value to indicate which RCF port to use to connect to the alternate Content Manager Workgroup Server. Note that this will only be used if you specify a value for alternateWorkgroupServerName.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AlternateWorkgroupServerURL
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL used to connect to the alternate Content Manager Workgroup Server. The URL is in the format {protocol}://{machine}:{port}. Protocol and port components are optional and will default to TCP and 1137, respectively.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AlwaysCheckSpelling
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether a spelling check should be enforced for every user upon any modifications to Title and Notes fields.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AuditActive
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether events should be logged to the Content Manager Audit Log.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AuditLogContainer
member.summary: Gets or sets a Record object which is used as a container when cataloguing audit logs into TRIM

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AuditLogRecordType
member.summary: Gets or sets a RecordType object which is used when cataloguing audit logs into TRIM

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AutoConnect
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether an automatic connection should be made to the workgroup server. If turned off (it is on by default), you can start the Database in an 'offline' mode which allows certain objects to be managed without a workgroup connection.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AutoFinalizeEmail
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean parameter indicating that when creating a record from an email message, automatically finalize the record.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AutoGenerateThumbnail
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating that a thumbnail rendition should be automatically generated for a %b_record%.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AutomaticallyOCR
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether to automatically convert new image documents to text using the Image Processing functions of %R_trim%.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.AutoVitalRecordReview
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether Vital Classifications and Records must automatically have a Vital Record Review and Update assigned. This will cause all records with Scheduled Tasks attached to be automatically processed and placed in the Scheduled Tasks Due tray of the responsible location when the due date for the Scheduled Task arrives. An email notification will also be sent to the responsible location upon this event.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.BlueprintsConverted
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate whether all Document Templates and Content Blocks have been converted to the new Office 2007 Open XML format

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.BypassBobChildListLimits
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether a site can bypass the BOBchildList limits

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CalculateDispositionEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether Schedule events should be created for this database and processed by the Event Server. This property also enables the calculation and recalculation of Retention Schedule Trigger dates whenever these events occur (upon the creation/modification of any Retention Schedules) and activates Pending Event Search functionality.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CascadeClassifications
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether a classification applied to a folder or a box should be cascaded down to all its contents

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CascadeParentFields
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean parameter indicating that, when creating a new record for a classification, client or matter, relevant user-defined field values will be copied from the parent item to the new record.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CatalogAuditLogs
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to catalog offline audit log files into TRIM

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CheckForDocumentLinks
member.summary: Gets a boolean value to indicate whether TRIM should check submitted documents to see if they contain links to separate external documents. If enabled, TRIM will provide some special options for managing these linked documents. Corresponds to the Embedded Links product feature.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CheckForDuplicateDocuments
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether TRIM should check for duplicate documents when creating new records (requires Document Hashing feature to be enabled)

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CheckForDuplicateEmailMessages
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether TRIM should check for duplicate email messages when creating new records based on email messages

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ClassificationLastNumber
member.summary: Gets the last number used for creating top level classifications.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ClassificationsNeedApproval
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether classification require an approval process before being available for use.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ClassificationTopPattern
member.summary: Gets the numbering pattern used for top level classifications.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ClassifiedSecurity
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating whether the Classified Security functionality specific to Us DoD (United States Department of Defense) 5015.2 compliance should be activated. Corresponds to the Classified Security product feature.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ClientDocumentCacheSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a number indicating how many megabytes to reserve for a client side document cache for TRIM. TRIM will remove older documents if the client document cache exceeds this limit. You must enable document caching using the UseClientDocumentCache parameter before this setting will take effect.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ClientRecordAccessReferenced
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether the client record provides access control and security references to all records for that client

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CollectUpdateComments
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to display an update comment facility for audit log entries

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ConfirmContactValidation
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether strict validation for Record contacts should be used. When true, the user is forced to validate (via KwikSelect) every contact selection made.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ConfirmLocationValidation
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether strict validation for all Record locations should be used. When true, the user is forced to validate (via KwikSelect) every location selection made.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ConsignmentApprovalReminderDays
member.summary: Gets or sets a number indicating how many days to wait before sending a reminder to consignment approvers to complete the approval process

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ContainerRulesForAlternate
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating that containment rules should apply to alternate containers as well as the main container.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.ContentIndex
member.summary: Gets a ContentIndexType enumerated value indicating the features of the content index available with with this dataset.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CreateUdfChangedEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to create an event whenever an additional field value is modified

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CurrencyDecimalDigits
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer containing the number of digits to be displayed after the decimal symbol for the currency used in this database.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CurrencyDecimalSymbol
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the decimal symbol to be used for the currency in this database. For example '.' or ','.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CurrencyGroupingFmt
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer indicating how the currency should be grouped in this database. That is, it indicates how many numbers should be assembled in each group. For example, the value '3' will correspond to a grouping: '123,456,789'. The separation character is held in the database.currGroupingSymbol property

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CurrencyGroupingSymbol
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the grouping symbol to be used for the currency in this database. For example ',' or ' '. This determines the separator used in the number arrangement of numbers before the decimal symbol in this currency. The grouping format is held in the database.currGroupingFmt property

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CurrencyNegativeFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a number indicating how negative currency amounts should be displayed in this database. The integer values correspond to the following set formats: 0: '($1.1)', 1: '-$1.1', 2 '$-1.1', 3 '$1.1-', 4 '(1.1$)', 5 '-1.1$', 6 '1.1-$', 7 '1.1$-', 8 '1.1$-', 9 '-1.1 $', 10 '-$ 1.1', 11 '1.1 $-', 12 '$ 1.1-', 13 '$ -1.1', 14 '1.1- $', 15 '($ 1.1)', 16 '(1.1 $)'.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CurrencyPositiveFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a number indicating how positive currency amounts should be displayed in this database. The integer values correspond to the following set formats: 0 '$1.1', 1 '1.1$', 2 '$ 1.1', 3 '1.1 $'.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CurrencySymbol
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the symbol for the currency used in this database. For example '$'.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CurrentUser
member.summary: Gets the Content Manager Location corresponding to the current logged in user.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.CurrentWorkgroup
member.summary: Gets a string containing the name of the current Workgroup Server. Set the property Database.WorkgroupServerName to specify which Workgroup Server to use.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.DataSecurity
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether records with a higher Security Profile than the Current User should not be retrieved (and displayed amongst the search results) when searching in this database. The value of this property is true by default.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.DblClickContainers
member.summary: Gets or sets a DblClickContainerStyle enum that determines what happens when a user double clicks on a container

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.DblClickDocsDesktop

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.DblClickDocsTrim
member.summary: Gets or sets a DblClickStyle enum that determines what the happens when a user double clicks on a document in %R_TRIM%

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.DblClickExtLink
member.summary: Gets or sets a external link to run when a user double clicks on a record

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.Dbms
member.summary: Gets a databaseTypes enumerated value indicating the type of DBMS used for this TRIM dataset.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.DeclassifyYears
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer containing the number of years set as the default declassification period for classified records (if not otherwise specified).

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.DeduplicationThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets a file size parameter (bytes) to indicate the minimum size a document needs to be before it is considered suitable for de-duplication.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database.DefaultAssigneeFromClassificationOwner
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether the default assignee for a record should be based on the Owner Location of a selected classification.
