member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList
member.summary: The TrimAccessControlList class is used to encapsulate the access controls that can be applied to an object an access control list consists of an array of entries that control who has access to a particular restricted function. These restricted functions may differ depending upon which object the access control list applies to, for example a meeting object may wish to restrict who can 'Take Minutes'. Each object that support access control lists will have an enum describing its set of restricted functions - in this class, the elements of this enum are simple defined as an int.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.GetAccessAllowed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the currently logged in user is provided access to the specified function.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.GetAccessAllowedForUser(System.Int32,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Location)
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the given user is provided access to the specified function.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.GetAsString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a string containing a description of the nominated access control for this object. The string consists of a list of location names for this Access Control, delimited by semicolons.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.get_AccessLocations(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of locations that should be given access to the specified function. When updating the list, if the new list is empty or null, access to that function will revert to 'Everyone' or 'Public', otherwise the current user list will be replaced.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetAccessLocationsOrContainer(System.Int32,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.LocationList)
member.summary: A special function that will set access to the specified function to the nominated set of locations, however will also include any locations in the corresponding access control of the container to be included.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetPrivate(System.Int32,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Location)
member.summary: Sets the access control for the nominated function to be a single location.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetPrivateOrContainer(System.Int32,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Location)
member.summary: A special function that will set access to the specified function to the nominated location, however will also include any locations in the corresponding access control of the container to be included.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetInherited(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the access control for the nominated function to be inherited from the record's container

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetPublic(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the access control for the nominated function to be public

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.get_CurrentSetting(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets an AccessControlSettings enum value indicating whether the Access Control is Inherited, Private (Custom) or Public. Note that the Inherited value only applied to record, indicating that the record's access control is based on the record's container. If you change this value to 'Private', it will be made private to the currently logged in user

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.get_ReferenceStyle(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets an AccessReferenceStyle enum value indicating how this access control list is is to be applied to the target object which it will be copied to. Reference style only applies to access controls that are to be copied, i.e. the default record access control that is defined for a record type. Check the IsCopied property to see if this is applicable.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetAllInherited
member.summary: Allows you to set all the access controls to be based on the record's container

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetAllPrivate(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.LocationList)
member.summary: Allows you to set all the access controls to the nominated list of locations

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetAllPrivate(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Location)
member.summary: Allows you to set all the access controls to the nominated single location

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetAllPrivate
member.summary: Allows you to set all the access controls to the current user

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.SetAllPublic
member.summary: Allows you to set all the access controls to the 'Public'/'Everyone' same setting.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.FunctionEnum
member.summary: Gets the enumeration which lists the functions that are applicable for this access control list.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.IsCopied
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating if this access control list is one that is a copy default list.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimAccessControlList.IsModified
member.summary: Gets a boolean parameter indicating if any changes have been made to this access control list since it was first constructed.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.RuntimeEnvironment
member.summary: Gets or sets an Environments enum value indicating the type of runtime environment the SDK application is running in. Certain areas of TRIM functionality may be disabled depending on what is appropriate for the runtime environment specified.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.SDKVersion
member.summary: Gets an integer containing the version number of the HP.HPTRIM.SDK.dll (the HP TRIM Software Development Kit) that is currently installed.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.SoftwareVersion
member.summary: Gets a string containing the HP TRIM version number and build number that is currently installed.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.WebServerWorkPath
member.summary: Gets a string value representing the working folder currently being used by a WebService application.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.ServiceType
member.summary: Gets a ServiceTypes enum value indicating that the Application is running as a particular type of service.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.setAsService
member.summary: Notifies the SDK that this application is running as a Windows service. Can only be called once in your application.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.SetAsWebService(System.String)
member.summary: Notifies the SDK that this application is running as a Web Service. Can only be called once in your application. To run as a web service, you must specify a path for storing temporary per-user work files. If the path parameter is left blank or NULL, TRIM will consult the local machine registry to see if a web service path has been defined there.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.BinaryPath
member.summary: Returns the name of the Windows folder where the HP TRIM software is installed

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.TemporaryPath
member.summary: Returns a string containing the name of a Windows folder that is a good place to create temporary files

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.HelpFileName
member.summary: Gets the name of the TRIM help file, based on the current language being used

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.GetHelpFileNameForLanguage(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Language)
member.summary: Gets the name of the TRIM help file for the nominated language

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.HasUserInterface
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating if the running application has access to a user interface.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.ProcessMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Processes the specified string, replacing any special TRIM substitution string (e.g. %B_record%, %E_tt_Favorites%, etc)

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.ProcessMessage(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database,System.String)
member.summary: Processes the specified string, replacing any special TRIM substitution string (e.g. %B_record%, %E_tt_Favorites%, etc). The supplied database parameter allows any local customized captions to be used instead of standard TRIM captions.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.IsLanguageSupported(System.Int16)
member.summary: Indicates if the current installation of HPE Content Manager has a localization available for the nominated language

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.SetDefaultLanguage(System.Int16)
member.summary: Sets the current thread default language to be used for subsequent calls to GetMessage and any other functions that are language specific. Note that this default will not be used if a connected Database object is provided. The function returns false if the specified language is not supported. The language is specified using the standard Windows Language Identifier.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.IsLanguageSupported(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Language)
member.summary: Indicates if the current installation of HPE Content Manager has a localization available for the nominated language

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.SetDefaultLanguage(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Language)
member.summary: Sets the current thread default language to be used for subsequent calls to GetMessage and any other functions that are language specific. Note that this default will not be used if a connected Database object is provided. The function returns false if the specified language is not supported. The language is specified using using the TRIM enumeration for currently supported TRIM languages.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.GetDatabaseIds(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a list of database ids that are supported by a particular workgroup server. Note that the returned set of database ids are not authenticated, it is possible that the current user may not have access to some or all of them.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.GetTimeZones
member.summary: Gets the list of windows time zone display strings.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimApplication.MIMETypeToFileType(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a MIME type to a Windows File Type extension string, according to the list of known file types used by HP TRIM.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimChildObject.Delete
member.summary: Permanently removes this object and all its associated child objects from the database.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimChildObject.Name
member.summary: Gets a string name for this object which is a user-friendly way of displaying this object. For most TRIM objects the name is a unique string, although some times this is not the case (eg Location Names).

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimChildObject.Idx
member.summary: Gets the position in the child object list that this child object occupies.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimChildObjectList.Count
member.summary: Gets a count of the number of child objects in this collection.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimChildObjectList.getItem(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets the next ApiTrimChild in the list

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimChildObjectList.FindChildByUri(System.Int64)
member.summary: Gets the next ApiTrimChild in the list

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimChildObjectList.TrimType
member.summary: Gets a BaseObjectTypes enum value indicating the type of this object.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent
member.summary: The TrimEvent class represents an event generated by a Trim client. This class is used by event processor add ins and encapsulates the information that is available in a Trim event.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent.EventType
member.summary: Gets the Events enumeration value that indicates what type of event occurred.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent.EventDate
member.summary: Gets the date and time that this event was generated.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent.ObjectType
member.summary: Gets the BaseObjectTypes enumeration which identifies which TRIM object the event occurred to. Most events in TRIM are related to a particular TRIM object.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent.ObjectUri
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the TRIM object that the event occurred to. Most events in TRIM are related to a particular TRIM object.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent.RelatedObjectType
member.summary: Gets the BaseObjectTypes enumeration which identifies a related TRIM object that is relevant to this event. (For example, if the Assignee of a record is changed, the ObjectType will be a Record, the RelatedObjectType could be a Location.)

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent.RelatedObjectUri
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of a related TRIM object that is relevant to this event. (For example, if the Assignee of a record is changed, the ObjectUri will be the Record's uri, the RelatedObjectUri could be the Uri of a Location representing the new Assignee.)

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent.FromMachine
member.summary: Gets the name of the computer that generated the event.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent.ConnectionIPAddress
member.summary: Gets the IP address of the machine that generated the event.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent.ClientIPAddress
member.summary: Gets the IP address of the client that generated the event.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent.FromTimeZone
member.summary: Gets the time zone that the user generating the event was working in. This is the number of minutes from GMT, with a positive number indicating a time zone ahead of GMT. For example Australian Eastern Standard Time = 600, US Pacific Time = -480.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent.LoginName
member.summary: Gets a string indicating the login name used by the user generating this event.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent.LoginUri
member.summary: Gets unique identifier of the TRIM Location representing the user who generated this event.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEvent.ExtraDetails
member.summary: Gets a string which details any extra information pertinent to the event. What is contained in this property is largely dependent on the type of event.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEventProcessorAddInBase
member.summary: The TrimEventProcessor class is an abstract base class from which SDK developers can derive to create their own SDK.Net Event Processing AddIn.Note that your derived class must not require any constructor parameters.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEventProcessorAddInBase.#ctor
member.summary: The TrimEventProcessorAddIn constructor, doesn't do a lot.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEventProcessorAddInBase.internal_ProcessEvent(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.SwigArgumentPack)
member.summary: The ProcessEvent method will be called by the TRIM Event Processing service so that third-party apps can do something in response to TRIM events.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimEventProcessorAddInBase.internal_Test(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.SwigArgumentPack)
member.summary: The Test method is called by TRIM Enterprise Studio to see if the addIn can be loaded correctly. You can overload this method to do your own extra testing if you wish. Return an empty or null string to indicate the test succeeded, otherwise an error message.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject.Save
member.summary: Permanently commits all changes made to this object (and all its child objects). For new objects a new unique identifier will be allocated (Uri).

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject.MakeReference(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a TRIM reference file for this object, given the path and filename. A reference file can be associated with the Open command of various of the TRIM executables - TRIM.exe, TRIMDesktop.exe, etc. When the reference file is double-clicked, the associated application will then launch (or activate if it already running) and the object will then be displayed inside that executable. Returns a string containing the path and filename of the reference file created.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject.Delete
member.summary: Permanently removes this object and all its associated child objects from the database.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject.IsDeleteOk
member.summary: Determines if this object can be deleted. If it returns false, check the ErrorMessage details for more information. It is possible that the ErrorMessage property could contain a warning message even though the function returns true.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject.LastUpdatedOn
member.summary: Returns the date and time that changes to this object were last committed.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject.Name
member.summary: Gets a string name for this object which is a user-friendly way of displaying this object. For most TRIM objects the name is a unique string, although some times this is not the case (eg Location Names).

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject.Verify(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Verifies all properties that have been modified since this object was last saved. Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the function succeeded. If false, the error description is stored in the ErrorMessage property.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject.Verified
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating whether the object has been verified. That is, whether a call to the 'Verify' method has been made and has succeeded.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject.GetChildObjectList(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Retrieves the child object collection of the nominated child object type.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject.IsInFavorites
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether this object is in the current user's list of favorites

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject.GetNewCopy
member.summary: Creates a new TrimMainObject which is a copy of this TrimMainObject. Where appropriate, property values are copied from this TrimMainObject to the new TrimMainObject. You will generally need to set any unique properties manually afterwards, prior to committing this new TrimMainObject to the TRIM database with the Save() method. See also the NewCopy function of the derived objects that implement this capability. Will return NULL if this object does not support the Copy function.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject.UpdateComment
member.summary: Gets or sets a string value to be recorded with any audit entries related to the update of this object

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject.Refresh
member.summary: Resets this object to the current state on the database, will revert any changes that might have been made. Only required if you are not using BOBnotifications, or need to guarantee a really up-to-date version of the object state.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch
member.summary: The TrimMainObjectSearch represents a collection of TrimMainObjects that can be enumerated. It basically represent a database query, and so it it works a little differently to a static array. It is designed for performance to prefetch only the next batch of items, as Trim databases can quite often contain very large collections.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.#ctor(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Database,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.BaseObjectTypes)
member.summary: Constructs a main object list for the specified TRIM object type.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.#ctor(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.SavedSearch)
member.summary: Constructs a main object list based on a previously saved search

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.#ctor(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.LookupSet)
member.summary: Constructs a main object list to search for items within a lookup set.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.ErrorMessage
member.summary: All TRIM SDK objects have an ErrorMessage property which can be used to examine any error that may have occurred in the most recent method call.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.Error
member.summary: All TRIM SDK objects have an Error property which can be used to examine any error that may have occurred in the most recent method call.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.Database
member.summary: Gets the TRIM Database object in which this collection resides.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.TrimType
member.summary: Gets a BaseObjectTypes enum value indicating the type of object in this collection.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.Icon
member.summary: Gets the icon associated this object collection.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.GetResultAsUriArray
member.summary: Gets a URI list object representing the results of the search.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.GetResultAsUriArray(System.Int64)
member.summary: Gets a URI list object representing the results of the search, limited by maxUrisToReturn.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.GetResultAsUriArraySorted(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyOrFieldDef,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a URI list object that allows you to iterate all the objects that are currently selected, with the option of sorting by the supplied sortField. Use this sorting technique when you need to sort by a field that is not part of the SearchClauseIds sortable set. It requires results to be downloaded first and then sorted, so it can take some time if there are lots of results.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.GetResultAsUriArraySorted(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyOrFieldDef,System.Boolean,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyOrFieldDef,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a URI list object that allows you to iterate all the objects that are currently selected, with the option of sorting by the supplied sortField. Use this sorting technique when you need to sort by a field that is not part of the SearchClauseIds sortable set. It requires results to be downloaded first and then sorted, so it can take some time if there are lots of results.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.GetResultAsUriArraySorted(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyOrFieldDef,System.Boolean,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyOrFieldDef,System.Boolean,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyOrFieldDef,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a URI list object that allows you to iterate all the objects that are currently selected, with the option of sorting by the supplied sortField. Use this sorting technique when you need to sort by a field that is not part of the SearchClauseIds sortable set. It requires results to be downloaded first and then sorted, so it can take some time if there are lots of results.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.Title
member.summary: Gets a string briefly describing the selection criteria used for this collection.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.FastCount
member.summary: Gets a number indicating a likely number of items in the collection. Since the building of the collection is dynamic, this count value could change depending on whether new items are added during the iterating of the collection. To obtain this count, a separate SQL query is issued - if that is not possibly for some reason, the value -1 will be returned.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.Count
member.summary: Gets a number indicating a the number of items in the collection at the time of the call. Since the building of the collection is dynamic, this count value could change depending on whether new items are added during the iterating of the collection. To obtain this count, a separate SQL query is attempted. If that is not possible, the query is executed and the results are iterated, so in some cases it may be slow.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.QueryInfoMessage
member.summary: Gets a string describing any information about the search. For example, if the content clause in the search was unable to return all of the results.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SearchString
member.summary: Gets a string value representing the main search criteria for this list. See the TRIM HELP documentation for a comprehensive description of the Query String formatting rules.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SetSearchString(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a string value representing the main search criteria for this list. See the TRIM HELP documentation for a comprehensive description of the Query String formatting rules.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.ClearSearch
member.summary: Clears any search criteria currently in force (unless new search criteria are added), the search will return no results.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AddSearchClause(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause)
member.summary: Adds the specific search criteria to the reverse-polish clause stack

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.And
member.summary: Adds the AND operator to the reverse-polish clause stack

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.Or
member.summary: Adds the OR operator to the reverse-polish clause stack

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.Not
member.summary: Adds the NOT operator to the reverse-polish clause stack

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.GetSearchAsStack
member.summary: Gets a TrimSearchStack array that represents this search. This array is in a reverse polish format which doesn't include any precedence operators.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SetSearchFromStack(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchStack)
member.summary: Sets the search to be based on the supplied search stack

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.FilterString
member.summary: Gets a string value representing the current filters that are applied together with the search criteria for this list. See the TRIM HELP documentation for a comprehensive description of the Filter String formatting rules.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SetFilterString(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a string value representing the current filters that are applied together with the search criteria for this list. See the TRIM HELP documentation for a comprehensive description of the Filter String formatting rules.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.ClearFilters
member.summary: Clears any filters that are currently operating on the search.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SetFiltersToDefault
member.summary: Sets the filters to the previously saved set of default filters for the current user.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SaveFiltersAsDefault
member.summary: Sets the current filters to be the default filters for the current user.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AddFilterClause(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause)
member.summary: Adds the specific search criteria to the array of filters

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.GetFiltersAsArray
member.summary: Gets an array of TrimSearchStackItem objects that represents this search. This array is in a reverse polish format which doesn't include any precedence operators.

member.summary: Gets a string value representing a sort criteria for this list. See the TRIM HELP documentation for a comprehensive description of the Sort String formatting rules.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SetSortString(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a string value representing a sort criteria for this list. See the TRIM HELP documentation for a comprehensive description of the Sort String formatting rules.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.ClearSort
member.summary: Clears any sort criteria that currently operate on the search.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SuppressDefaultSort
member.summary: Ensures that if no sort criteria are specified, results are not sorted according to a default sort order. You can use this function if you have a list set as a uri list and want to preserve that ordering.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SetSortToDefault
member.summary: Sets the filters to the previously saved set of default filters for the current user.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SaveSortAsDefault
member.summary: Sets the current filters to be the default filters for the current user.

member.summary: Adds the specific search item to the list of sort criteria for this search

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AddSortItemDescending(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.SearchClauseIds)
member.summary: Adds the specific search item to the list of sort criteria for this search

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AddSortUserFieldAscending(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.FieldDefinition)
member.summary: Adds the user-defined field to the list of sort criteria for this search

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AddSortUserFieldDescending(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.FieldDefinition)
member.summary: Adds the user-defined field to the list of sort criteria for this search

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.GetSortAsArray
member.summary: Gets an array of TrimSearchSortItem objects that represents the sorting criteria.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SetOptionsToDefault
member.summary: Sets the search options for this search to be the users preferred default

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SaveOptionsAsDefault
member.summary: Sets the current options to be the default options for the current user.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.TopContainersFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a 'top containers' filter used for special aggregated archive search

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AssigneeSearchIncludesAuthorisation
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when searching by activity assignee, the search engine will also return any activities that are awaiting authorising by the specified action officer

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AssigneeSearchIncludesDelegates
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when searching by an assignee (records, record actions, activities, etc) and the assignee corresponds to the currently logged in user, results will also include those items assigned to anyone who has delegated work to the currently logged in user.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AssigneeSearchIncludesEscalated
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when searching by activity assignee, the search engine will also return any activities that have been escalated to the specified action officer

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AssigneeSearchIncludesGroups
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when searching by an assignee (records, record actions, activities, etc) and the assignee corresponds to the currently logged in user, results will also include those items assigned to any location that the current user is a member of

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AssigneeSearchIncludesPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when searching by an assignee (records, record actions, activities, etc) results will also include those items assigned to the positions of any locations specified in the search

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.IdolSearchStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets an IdolSearchStyles enumeration value indicating whether to optimize this search by utilizing the IDOL search engine for some types of search methods.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.ExtendedIDOLOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that the search optimizer should attempt to convert additional search methods to uri list based searches which can be resolved by the IDOL search engine

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AnyWordIncludesTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when searching by the AnyWord method, whether the search should include the record title.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AnyWordIncludesNotes
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when searching by the AnyWord method, whether the search should include the record notes.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AnyWordIncludesContents
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when searching by the AnyWord method, whether the search should include any document content associated with the record.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.IncludeLocationsByAddressReference
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when searching for locations, include any that match because of a 'use address of' reference

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.IncludeLocationsByProfileReference
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when searching for locations, include any that match because of a 'use profile of' reference

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.AlphaObjectSort
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate whether to use alphabetical order for object sorting

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.UseDirectIDOLquery
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate whether to Allow direct IDOL queries

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.TempTableSecurityFiltering
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate whether to create a temporary table to optimize record security filtering (only applies to SQL Server)

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.UnionForOrOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate whether to optimize the query by replacing OR operators with a UNION arrangement

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.DefaultIncludesNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when doing a record default search, look for matching record numbers.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.DefaultIncludesTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when doing a record default search, look for matches in record titles.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.DefaultIncludesNotes
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when doing a record default search, look for matches in record notes.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.DefaultIncludesContent
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that when doing a record default search, look for matching record document content.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.GetSearchOption(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyDef)
member.summary: Gets or sets a search option value using the generic PropertyDef object

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SearchAsXML
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing an XML representation of the search. This XML is language and locale independent and can be used for persisting a query for later execution, perhaps by a user using a different language.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.HitHighlightString
member.summary: Gets a string containing a string that can be used for hit highlighting in a document viewer. It basically contains an array of content search related strings, separated by commas. It can be passed to the ExtractDocument class when producing a HTML rendering that highlights hits

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SelectByPrefix(System.String)
member.summary: Sets this collection to contain objects with names that begin with the nominated string.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SelectFavorites
member.summary: Sets the collection to contain objects that are in the current user's Favorites list.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SelectFavorites(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.FavoriteType)
member.summary: Sets the collection to contain objects that are in the current user's Favorites list.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SelectByUserLabel(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.UserLabel)
member.summary: Sets the collection to contain objects lonked to the nominated user label.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SelectNone
member.summary: Sets the collection to contain no objects.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SelectAll
member.summary: Sets the collection to contain all objects of this collection's Type. Use with care as some Trim Databases can be very large.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SelectByUris(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimURIList)
member.summary: Sets the collection to contain all objects with unique identifiers matching those in the specified array.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SelectTopLevels
member.summary: Sets the collection to contain all objects which are at the top level of the hierarchy. Only useful for objects that implement hierarchy, such as classifications, labels, schedules, etc.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SelectThoseWithin(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject)
member.summary: Sets the collection to contain all objects which placed within a hierarchy where the nominated object is its parent. The list must be for hierarchical objects and the parent object must be of the same object type as the list.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SetPurpose(System.Int32)
member.summary: Call this method to indicate that the items in the list may need to be used for the nominated purpose. To determine what the valid purposes are, look at the IsValidFor functions in the derived TrimMainObject classes. In some instances (not all), the purpose value will remove certain items from the selection.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SetPurpose(System.Int32,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject)
member.summary: Call this method to indicate that the items in the list may need to be used for the nominated purpose. To determine what the valid purposes are, look at the IsValidFor functions in the derived TrimMainObject classes The purposeExtraObject is necessary for some purpose types - once again, the derived TrimMainObject class will have more information. In some instances (not all), the purpose value will remove certain items from the selection.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SetPurpose(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Call this method to indicate that the items in the list may need to be used for the nominated purpose. To determine what the valid purposes are, look at the IsValidFor functions in the derived TrimMainObject classes The purposeExtraObject is necessary for some purpose types - once again, the derived TrimMainObject class will have more information. In some instances (not all), the purpose value will remove certain items from the selection.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.ClearPurpose
member.summary: Removes the current purpose setting for this list.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.IsValidForPurpose(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject)
member.summary: Determines if the specified object is valid for the current purpose associated with this list.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.ItemMatches(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject)
member.summary: Determines if the specified object matches the criteria for this search

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.WebURL
member.summary: Gets a string representing a URL that can be used to display this search in a web browser.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.MakeReference(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a TRIM reference file for this search, given the path and filename. A reference file can be associated with the Open command of various of the TRIM executables - TRIM.exe, TRIMDesktop.exe, etc. When the reference file is double-clicked, the associated application will then launch (or activate if it already running) and a new search will then be displayed inside that executable. Returns a string containing the path and filename of the reference file created.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SkipToUri
member.summary: Gets or sets a TRIM uri value which will be skipped to when iterating through the results of this list. When you set this parameter, search results will be ignored until a result matching the specified uri is found, once the skip uri is found, results are returned from that point on (includes the skip uri in the result)

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.PagingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to indicate that the results of the search are going to be accesses in a web browser "one page at a time" style. When in paging mode, results will be uniquely sorted in order that when you use the SkipCount parameter to move to the next page, you are assured that the query will be working through the same results. Set this proeprty if you intend to use SkipCount and LimitOnRowsReturned for the search results.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.SkipCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a skip counter which indicates how many items to skip before returning any search results. When you set the value of the skip counter, results will be read and discarded until the specified number of items to skip has been reached. Note that a SkipToUri value can be specified in addition. Set the value to 0 if you wish to clear the skip behavior

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.LimitOnRowsReturned
member.summary: Gets or sets a limit on the number of objects that should be returned as part of this search. This is useful if you wish to display, say, the most recently modified 10 records. Set the value to 0 if you wish to clear the limit behavior

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.ReportAsHTML(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Report,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a report on a list of objects with output in HTML and following the nominated report design layout. The image folder name is used as a location for any hyper-links to images created by the report generator.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.ReportAsHTML(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Report,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a report on a list of objects with output in HTML and following the nominated report design layout. The image folder name is used as a location for any hyper-links to images created by the report generator. If you leave the value blank, the function will create a sub-folder within the path of the outputHTMLfileName if one is needed.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.PublishAsHTML(System.String,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.HtmlLayout,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.HtmlLayout,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimDateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Publishes the objects in this collection to HTML according to nominated HTML layouts. The detailed layout is optional.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObjectSearch.ExportAsXML(System.String,System.Int32,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.XmlDocumentExportType,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Exports the objects in this collection to an XML output file

members.member: Note that the IEnumerator documentation requires an InvalidOperationException to be thrown whenever the collection is modified. This has been done for changes in the size of the collection but not when one of the elements of the collection is modified as it is a bit tricky to detect unmanaged code that modifies the collection under our feet.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject.TrimType
member.summary: Gets a BaseObjectTypes enum value indicating the type of this object.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject.Uri
member.summary: Gets the unique row identifier for this object. Once an object has been committed to the database, typically by calling a Save method, this unique identifier is allocated. From that time on, the uri will remain constant and can never be changed. It is always unique across all objects of the same Type.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject.URN
member.summary: Gets the uniform resource name for this object.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject.NameString
member.summary: Gets a string name for this object which is a user-friendly way of displaying this object. For most TRIM objects the name is a unique string, although some times this is not the case (eg Location Names).

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject.NameStringExtra
member.summary: Gets a more verbose description of this object, particularly when the name is perhaps a little cryptic or not enough to fully describe the object.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject.IsMandatory(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.FieldDefinition)
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indication whether the specified field must have a non-NULL value for this object.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a boolean parameter indicating if this object is "ReadOnly". This would generally indicate that none of the object's properties could be modified, in some cases there are exceptions that can be tested via CanModifyProperty method.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject.IsValidFor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Call this method to determine if this object can be used for the nominated purpose. To determine what the valid purposes are, look in the derived class at the more type safe versions of this function.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject.IsValidFor(System.Int32,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimMainObject)

To determine what the valid purposes are, look in the derived class at the more type safe versions of this function. The purposeExtraObject is necessary for some purpose types - once again, the derived class will have more information.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject.IsValidFor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Call this method to determine if this object can be used for the nominated purpose. To determine what the valid purposes are, look in the derived class at the more type safe versions of this function. The purposeExtraInformation is necessary for some purpose types - once again, the derived class will have more information.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject.HasPermission(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.GenericPermissions)
member.summary: Checks to see if the currently logged in user has permission to perform the generic action on this object

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject.HasPropertyPermission(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.GenericPermissions,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyIds)
member.summary: Checks to see if the currently logged in user has permission to perform the generic action on the specified property of this object

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject.PossiblyHasSubordinates
member.summary: Indicates if this object could possibly have child objects of the same type that can be displayed in a hierarchy.

members.member: Note that the IEnumerator documentation requires an InvalidOperationException to be thrown whenever the collection is modified. This has been done for changes in the size of the collection but not when one of the elements of the collection is modified as it is a bit tricky to detect unmanaged code that modifies the collection under our feet.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimParserException
member.summary: A special form of TRIMexception that is used whenever a function is called that parses a string. If an error is detected, this class also gives you a start and end position within the string, to assist in displaying where the error actually was detected.

member.name: F:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimPathType.RenderConfigPath
member.summary: Content Manager Render Service Configuration File

member.summary: All TRIM SDK objects have an ErrorMessage property which can be used to examine any error that may have occurred in the most recent method call.

member.summary: All TRIM SDK objects have an Error property which can be used to examine any error that may have occurred in the most recent method call.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimPropertySet.Database
member.summary: Gets the TRIM Database object in which this object resides. All Trim objects live within a particular TRIM database and cannot be created without one.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimPropertySet.Caption
member.summary: Gets the user-defined caption that has been associated with all TrimPropertySets of this type.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimPropertySet.Icon
member.summary: Gets the icon value associated this TrimPropertySet.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimPropertySet.GetPropertyIcon(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyIds)
member.summary: Gets the icon value associated the a property of this object.

members.member: Each TRIM object has one or more properties. These properties have been abstracted, and each one allocated a unique property id. This allows general purpose controls, etc, to access property values in a generic way, without the need for reflection. This method returns the value of a property as a generic object. Depending on the Format of the property, the Object may be an Int or a TRIMdateTime etc.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimPropertySet.GetPropertyAsString(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyIds,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.StringDisplayType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a string representation of a property value in a format appropriate for a specific use.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimPropertySet.IsModified
member.summary: Gets a boolean parameter indicating if any changes have been made to this object since it was first constructed, or last saved.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimPropertySet.IsMandatory(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyIds)
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indication whether the specified property must have a non-NULL value for this object.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimPropertySet.VerifyProperty(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyIds,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Verifies the value of a particular property, by cross checking it against other property values. The ErrorMessage property provides details if the verification fails.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimPropertySet.CanModifyProperty(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.PropertyIds)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current user has the permission to modify the specified property.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSDKObject
member.summary: This class holds an APPError object as a member to allow all derived classes (pretty much everything in the API) to be able to store the results of an operation. The member m_error should always be 'reset' prior to calling a method that uses it.

member.summary: For parameterized searches (non-blank parameter caption indicates the method should accept parameter values before being run) Gets a short string providing some help text regarding how to format the search parameter string for this clause.

member.summary: For parameterized searches (non-blank parameter caption indicates the method should accept parameter values before being run) Set long and short strings providing some help text regarding how to format the search parameter string for this clause.

member.summary: Gets the User-Defined FieldDefinition upon which this search clause is based (if it is actually a user-defined field search).

member.summary: Gets a string value representing the criteria for this clause.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.ComparisonOperator
member.summary: Gets a ComparisonType enum value representing the comparison operator being used for matching with the criteria string

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromString(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause based on a string that could be typed by a user. This string criteria is identical to the criteria portion of the wider search string supported by the TrimMainObjectSearch, for example for a date search, the string could be 'last 3 days", for a disposition search it could be 'active'. If it fails, you can inspect the ErrorMessage property.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromString(System.String,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ComparisonType)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause based on a string that could be typed by a user. In addition, you can use one of the comparision operators if it is appropriate for the parameter type and value supplied.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromDateRange(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimDateTime,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimDateTime)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause to be a date range. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of DateTime (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is date time based.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromDateComparison(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.ComparisonType,HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimDateTime)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause to be a comparison to a specified date. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of DateTime (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is date time based. The dateValue can be determined from DateFrom/DateTo values.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.GetDateFrom
member.summary: Gets the low value of a date range search. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of DateTime (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is date time based.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.GetDateTo
member.summary: Gets the high value of a date range search. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of DateTime (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is date time based.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromUriArray(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimURIList)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause to be an array of uris. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of Object (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is object based.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromUriArray(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimURIList,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause to be an array of uris. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of Object (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is object based. You can specify an optional string describing this search clause which will be used to compose a title for the search.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromUriArray(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimURIList,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause to be an array of uris. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of Object (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is object based. You can specify an optional string describing this search clause which will be used to compose a title for the search. The recursive parameter allows you to specify whether to also select based on subordinate elements of the specified objects.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromSingleUri(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimURI)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause to be a single uri. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of Object (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is object based.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromSingleUri(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimURI,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause to be a single uri. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of Object (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is object based. You can specify an optional string describing this search clause which will be used to compose a title for the search.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromSingleUri(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimURI,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause to be a single uri. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of Object (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is object based. You can specify an optional string describing this search clause which will be used to compose a title for the search. The recursive parameter allows you to specify whether to also select based on subordinate elements of the specified objects.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromObject(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause to be a single uri of the supplied object. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of Object (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is object based). The supplied TrimObject must be of the correct type for the search clause.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromObject(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause to be a single uri. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of Object (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is object based). The supplied TrimObject must be of the correct type for the search clause. You can specify an optional string describing this search clause which will be used to compose a title for the search.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromObject(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause to be a single uri. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of Object (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is object based). The supplied TrimObject must be of the correct type for the search clause. You can specify an optional string describing this search clause which will be used to compose a title for the search. The recursive parameter allows you to specify whether to also select based on subordinate elements of the specified objects.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromSubSearch(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchStack)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause to be a search for an object. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of Object (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is object based). The supplied TrimObject must be of the correct type for the search clause.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SetCriteriaFromSubSearch(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchStack,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the search criteria for this clause to be a search for an object. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of Object (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is object based). The supplied TrimObject must be of the correct type for the search clause. The recursive parameter allows you to specify whether to also select based on subordinate elements of the specified objects.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.UriArrayCriteria
member.summary: Gets the current criteria value of a object search, if it is based on a uri Array. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of Object (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is object based).

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SingleUriCriteria
member.summary: Gets the current criteria value of a object search, if it is based on a single uri or object. This should only be used for search clauses that have a parameter format of Object (see SearchClauseDef class for information on how to determine if a search clause is object based).

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.IsRecursive
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating if the current criteria of an object search is to be applied recursively.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.IsSubSearch
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating if the current criteria of an object search is a sub-search.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SubSearch
member.summary: Gets a TrimSearchStack that represents a sub-search. A sub-search can be used if the search clause is based on a criteria which represents one of more TRIM main objects, for example, searching for records based on assignee. The specification of the assignee can be a location search. This stack returned will be in reverse polish format which doesn't include any precedence operators. Note that the function will return NULL if the search criteria is not a sub search.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.ItemMatches(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimObject)
member.summary: Determines if the specified object matches the criteria for this search

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.AccessControlType
member.summary: For the acl and copyacl search methods, there is an extra parameter, the access control type, used in conjunction with the location. A search string could look like acl:"Destroy Record",["Simpson, David"], in which case the search is composed of the "Destroy Record" access control type, plus a location sub-search.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.SubQueryObjectType
member.summary: For some methods (e.g. the userLabel stuckOn search method), there is an extra parameter, a dynamic object type, used in conjunction with the a search specification for that object. For example, a search string could look like stuckOn:location, ["Simpson, David"], in which case/ the search is for labels attached to locations, matching the location sub-search.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.RecordRelationshipType
member.summary: For the record relationship search method, you also need to specify the relationship type parameter

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchClause.RecordReverseRelationshipType
member.summary: For the record reverse relationship search method, you also need to specify the reverse relationship type parameter

member.summary: Construct a TrimSearchStack - basically an array of TrimSearchStackItem objects

member.summary: All TRIM SDK objects have an ErrorMessage property which can be used to examine any error that may have occurred in the most recent method call.

member.summary: All TRIM SDK objects have an Error property which can be used to examine any error that may have occurred in the most recent method call.

member.summary: Gets the TRIM Database object in which this search stack resides.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchStack.TrimType

member.summary: Gets a string value representing the main search criteria for this list. See the TRIM HELP documentation for a comprehensive description of the Query String formatting rules.

member.summary: Sets a string value representing the main search criteria for this list. See the TRIM HELP documentation for a comprehensive description of the Query String formatting rules.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchStack.ConvertToLinear
member.summary: Converts the stack to represent a linear stack representing what a user would type. Includes bracket operators to indicate order-of-precedence.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchStack.ConvertToReversePolish
member.summary: Converts the stack to a reverse-polish stack which is the way TRIM searches are formatted in the TrimMainObjectSearch search object.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchStack.IsReversePolish
member.summary: Gets a boolean property indicating if the stack is currently in reverse-polish format (otherwise it will be a linear stack). In most cases, stacks provided by SDK functions will be reverse-polish, so the only time the stack will be linear is if a specific call has been made to ConvertToLinear.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchStackItem
member.summary: The TrimSearchStackItem is an abstract base class representing an item that participates in the definition of a search criteria. As such, it can be a specific search clause (ie dateCreated = today) or an operator designed to be applied to preceding search clauses.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchStackItem.IsOperator
member.summary: Indicates if this search item is an operator (and, or, not)

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchStackItem.IsSearchClause
member.summary: Indicates if this search item is a search clause, eg "dateCreated = today"

This has been done for changes in the size of the collection but not when one of the elements of the collection is modified as it is a bit tricky to detect unmanaged code that modifies the collection under our feet.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchTopContainersFilter
member.summary: The ApiTrimSearchTopContainersFilter is a special filter applied to a search which is used to select top containers using an aggregated disposal method technique

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchTopContainersFilter.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a top container filter object

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchTopContainersFilter.DisposalType
member.summary: Gets or sets a ConsignmentDisposalType enumerated value indicating what type of disposal method will be required for this selection.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchTopContainersFilter.OnOrBeforeArchiveDate
member.summary: Gets or sets a date object indicating the cutoff date for any archiving action to be due.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchTopContainersFilter.MaxResults
member.summary: Gets or sets a number indicating the maximum number of results to be returned by this search.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchTopContainersFilter.OnlyBoxes
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating if only record types that have behavior of 'Box' will be selected (a common archiving use case for physical records).

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchTopContainersFilter.IncludeItemsOnHold
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating if records that are currently on hold will be retrieved when using this filter.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchTopContainersFilter.IncludeItemsInAConsignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating if records that are currently part of an existing consignment process will be retrieved when using this filter.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchTopContainersFilter.AggregateContents
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating if the contents of a top level folder should be examined for a conflicting disposal instructions (contents with a more severe disposal instruction will case the top container not to be selected).

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchTopContainersFilter.AggregateContentsRecursive
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating that if contents are being aggregated, whether to look inside the contents of the contents recursively.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSearchTopContainersFilter.AggregateExcludeScheduled
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating that the search should exclude any top level container that has a specific (i.e. not aggregated) disposal instruction specified.

member.name: T:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile
member.summary: The TrimSecurityProfile class is used to encapsulate the components of a security profile - these being a single security level which is a simple numerical scale, and an array of up to 45 user defined caveats which can either be on or off.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile.SecurityLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the security level associated with this security profile

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile.SecurityLevelNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the security level associated with this security profile, using the security level number property.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile.AddCaveat(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.SecurityCaveat)
member.summary: Adds the given Security Caveat object to the list of caveats in this security profile

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile.RemoveCaveat(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.SecurityCaveat)
member.summary: Removes the given Security Caveat object from the list of caveats in this security profile

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile.IsCaveatOn(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.SecurityCaveat)
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether a given Security Caveat is currently active in this security profile

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile.AsString
member.summary: Gets or sets the security profile based on a formatted string. The string contains the abbreviation of the security level, followed by one or more caveat abbreviations, separated by commas.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile.AsEmailString
member.summary: Gets the security profile as a specially formatted string suitable for inclusion in email header. Some mail systems automatically parse messages based on this string.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile.CanAccess(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile)
member.summary: Compares this security level with another to determine if an object with this security level is suitable to access another objected with the nominated security level. It will return true if this profiles security level number is greater than or equal to the supplied profile's level number, and that all the caveats that are on in the supplied profile are also on in this profile.

member.name: M:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile.UpgradeTo(HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile)
member.summary: This function will increase the security level number if necessary and possibly add caveats such that it will satisfy the CanAccess test for the supplied profile.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile.IsModified
member.summary: Gets a boolean parameter indicating if any changes have been made to this profile since it was first constructed.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.TrimSecurityProfile.AlwaysHighest
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean parameter indicating that this security profile is in an 'always highest' state. It is the equivalent of having a security level number > 99 and having every caveat turned on.

members.member: Note that the IEnumerator documentation requires an InvalidOperationException to be thrown whenever the collection is modified. This has been done for changes in the size of the collection but not when one of the elements of the collection is modified as it is a bit tricky to detect unmanaged code that modifies the collection under our feet.

member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether activities should be automatically started when they are ready to start.

member.summary: Gets the location who initially created this workflow.

member.summary: Gets a Boolean value indicating whether this workflow is overdue.

member.summary: Gets a string containing the job number for this workflow. This is an automatically generated number of the numbering pattern: 'YYYY/GGGGG'.

member.summary: Gets the location object that currently has this workflow locked.

member.summary: Gets the date and time that that this workflow was locked.

member.summary: Gets a string describing the current lock status of this workflow.

member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the name of this workflow.

member.summary: Gets or sets a currency value indicating an overhead cost for the workflow that is additional to the sum of activity costs.

member.summary: Gets the percentage value (00~100) indicating where the workflow progress is up to

member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether due dates for activities should be recalculated based on actual date completed if an activity is completed before its due date.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Workflow.RecalcWhenFinishLate
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether due dates for activities should be recalculated based on actual date completed if an activity is completed after its due date.

member.name: P:HP.HPTRIM.SDK.Workflow.RecalcWhenSuspended
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether due dates for activities should be recalculated based on increasing the estimated duration by the total duration an activity is suspended.
